Text: Allied Soldier: \n Now's our chance, run!
Imagine! Throwing away \n good money like that.

The old guard are few 
 and ill-equipped, they 
 won't cause us any 
 trouble.

And from now on, we're 
 not going to rely on 
 force, but persuasion to 
 lead the people.
I was originally from \n Elgona...
Get everyone to \n safety for me!
This city is \n changing fast.
I can't accept this, \n ma'am, I was just \n doing my duty.

And I hope you'll 
 continue to watch out 
 for us here in Havina in 
 the future.
But that's suicide!
My blue-masked saviour! \n Here's a little \n something for you.
And you. You're the one \n who got the boat here.
We're surrounded!
I've got to do something about the Nevi!
You don't need to \n throw your life away, \n I'll handle the Scarabs.

Don't think that just 
 because you're doing the 
 "right thing" 
 everything'll work out.
Alone!?
It's time I make \n up for that.
Everyone can change. \n It's time to forget \n the past.
Allied Soldier: \n Okay, let's go!
Phew, \n everyone made it!
That sounds like a good \n plan, you can only push \n people so far.
Okay, all aboard!

But I've been doing 
 horrible things for the 
 Garrison all these 
 years...

I hope someday soon 
 it'll become a place 
 where everyone can 
 be happy.

Compared to what 
 happened back at the 
 Bismalia, this is 
 nothing, right?
Just run for it! I'll \n distract them.
Hold on!

We have to stop him! 
 Who knows what 
 kind of trouble he'll 
 stir up.
It's okay. We've been \n watching him and the \n rest of the old guard.
We discovered their \n plans to stop the town \n meeting.
Thanks to you.

There were still problems to be solved, 
 but the people were accepting change, 
 and slowly, but surely, Jirga Para Lhao 
 was changing for the better.
Defeat the Scarabs
Lisa and the others are \n probably busy preparing \n for the town meeting.

It's so strange to see 
 all those people 
 gathered in Havina 
 though.
Hm?
I've got to help!
I've got to do something about the Nevi!

We can't let the city 
 fall into the hands of 
 the rebels! Are you 
 ready?
Yes sir! They won't see \n us coming, sir.

If we take them by 
 surprise and capture 
 Lisa and the other 
 leaders...
We'll nip this rebellion \n right in the bud!

They're trying to 
 rebuild the city, and 
 here these guys are 
 gearing up for war!
What are you planning?
It's y-you!
H-Help!
W-Wait! Don't leave your \n commander behind!
Ugh... I can't just \n leave him.
Look at all these \n people!
What insubordination! \n I'll have their hides \n for leaving me!
We need to evacuate \n before more Scarabs \n show up!
That blue mask... \n You're one of them!
Heeelp! Somebody \n heeeelp!

Commander, please, I'll 
 make sure you're 
 rewarded if you see us 
 to safety first.
M-Madam!
Wait! What about the \n rest of us!?
Q-Quiet, rebel scum!
We don't have time to \n fight at a time like \n this.
You're not taking his \n side, are you!?
You haven't \n changed at all!
I'm not taking anyone's \n side, I'm just trying to \n evacuate everyone.
See that? \n That's our ride \n out of here.
If we can get the people \n to that airboat...
I'll hold off the \n Scarabs, you get \n everyone to safety!
Got it! Let's go.
Rich Woman: \n Please, you can't leave me!
Little Girl: \n MOMMY!
Townsperson: \n Run!
Townsperson: \n Please, get us to the boat!
Townsperson: \n Hey, stop shovin'!
Townsperson: \n Have to stay calm... Have to stay calm...
Allied Soldier: \n Keep together now!
Townsperson: \n Scarabs... In Lei Havina!?
Townsperson: \n With her help, we might make it...
Townsperson: \n How far away is that boat anyway!?
Townsperson: \n Why isn't the Garrison here to help!?
Allied Soldier: \n The boat's on its way, stay calm!
Rich Woman: \n We'll be safe if we reach the boat, won't we?
Townsperson: \n Come on, everyone, we're almost there!
Townsperson: \n Be careful, we're not out of this yet!
Rich Woman: \n I simply can't run another step!
Allied Soldier: \n Come on, with me!
No!
Allied Soldier: \n Come on, with me!
I can't leave those people to the Nevi.
I've got to clear the way for those people!
Allied Soldier: \n Let's move.
They're almost home free.
Allied Soldier: \n Scarabs! Can you take care of 'em?
Allied Soldier: \n Don't panic, everyone.
Allied Soldier: \n Hey, you! Try pickin' on me!
I've got to help them!
They're in real trouble!
I'm coming!
Allied Soldier: \n I-I can't hold on much longer.
Allied Soldier: \n Don't panic, we've got help.
Allied Soldier: \n Keep behind me.
Allied Soldier: \n Stay together, everyone!
Defeat the Scarabs and \n Escort the People to the Boat
Allied Soldier: \n Watch it! We've got Scarabs.
Allied Soldier: \n Hold up, Scarabs!
More of 'em!
Allied Soldier: \n Another one!
Allied Soldier: \n We made it, the boat's right over there!
Allied Soldier: \n We'll make it through this!
Allied Soldier: \n I'll make sure you get to the airboat.
Allied Soldier: \n Hang in there!
Allied Soldier: \n Everyone stay together.
Allied Soldier: \n I won't let anything happen to you!
Allied Soldier: \n Scarabs, they're everywhere.
Allied Soldier: \n More Scarabs!
Allied Soldier: \n We've got more Scarabs around us.
Defeat the Scarabs
I can't leave those people to that fate.
Citizen: \n Help me!
Citizen: \n Get rid of the Scarabs!
Citizen: \n I-I can't hang on...
No!
That's the last of them!
Fear Level
